column9: My EF improved dramatically using this medication in combination with meds for blood pressure, cholesterol, allergy, and vitamins as prescribed by physician. Twenty-six months after treatment, however, I have been experiencing sleep difficulties and a sense my heart is beating too hard or irregularly at night.  Actually, I have a difficult time accurately describing the latter symptoms, but it is usually in bed that I experience this some troubling feeling concerning heartbeat. Also have some dizziness. The night pill, I was once convinced, used to help me sleep, which is why the cardiologist continued prescribing this second pill (decision made in June of this year--2011).  Since then have lost 12 pounds, which is when the dizziness, usual sense of heartbeat (let's say noticeable heartbeat at night, in bed), and difficulty sleeping really started.  The last symptom (and really the last two) may have also some stress-related causes, although I've actively addressed those.  So...today (Sat., Sept. 3) through Labor Day I will probably continue taking this second pill, but Tuesday Sept. 6, 2011 I am calling the physician.  Reason didn't react sooner is I have a follow-up appointment with family physician in early October and thought this could wait.
